title: If the product and H.C.F. of two numbers are 4107 and 37 respectively, then what is the smaller number? - Quora

response.answer_text: Let the smaller number be x. So, the bigger number would be 4107/x. Now, 4107 = 3*37*37 HCF = 37 Now, HCF is a factor of x. So, x is a multiple of 37. The smallest multiple of 37 is 37. So, x = 37. So, the smaller number is 37 and the bigger number is 4107/37 = 3*37*37/37 = 3*37 = 111.

37 Product of the numbers = 4107 = 37*37*3 And HCF is 37. So, it follows that one of the numbers has to be 37, and the other is 37*3. Check: This also makes sense given that their LCM is 37*3 = product/HCF = 4107/37

Since HCF of the two numbers is 37, which is a prime number, there can be no smaller number than it, hence the smallest number is 37. To find the other number we can use the formula: N1 * N2 = HCF * LCM 4107 = 37 * LCM LCM = 4107 / 37 Hence LCM and the orther number will be 111.
Product of 2 numbers =4107 HCF =37 Smallest number.? Product of the 2 numbers = HCF ×LCM of the same numbers 4107 =37×LCM LCM=4107/37=111 111 is the smallest number
The product = 4137 = 3×37×37 = (3×37)×37 = 3×(37²). Since 37 is a factor of both, the smaller of the two numbers is 37 and the larger one is (3×37) = 111 (= LCM).
